meanings.definition: To surpass in intelligence or cleverness.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys outsmarting her opponents in chess.
meanings.sent2: He is good at outsmarting his classmates during quizzes.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outsmarting the birds by hiding its nuts in different places.
meanings.sent4: The detective was outsmarting the criminals with his keen observation skills.
meanings.sent5: Outsmarting requires quick thinking and strategic planning.

meanings.definition: To outwit or outdo in a clever manner.
meanings.sent1: The fox was outsmarting the hunter by leading him in circles.
meanings.sent2: She was outsmarting her opponents in the game of wits.
meanings.sent3: The magician was outsmarting the audience with his clever illusions.
meanings.sent4: The hacker was outsmarting the security system with advanced technology.
meanings.sent5: Outsmarting the competition is essential in business.
